overview_of_class: The primary object of this course will be to use economic laboratory experiments - essentially interactive classroom activities from your perspective - to (1) help you solidify your understanding of economic principles, (2) give you insight into how, why, and when some models perform well while others struggle to predict outcomes, and (3) allow you to evaluate the legitimacy and applicability of conclusions based on economic experiments.
name: Experimental Economics
title: WCAS ECON 329-0-20 Experimental Economics

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: The primary object of this course will be to use economic laboratory experiments - essentially interactive classroom activities from your perspective - to (1) help you solidify your understanding of economic principles, (2) give you insight into how, why, and when some models perform well while others struggle to predict outcomes, and (3) allow you to evaluate the legitimacy and applicability of conclusions based on economic experiments.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 80-minutes lectures, 50-minute discussion section with required attendance.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Your grade will be based on problem sets, exams, final project, and participation in class experiments.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Markets, Games, and Strategic Behavior by Charles Holt, 2007 (ISBN: 978-0321419316)

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Because participation is such an integral part of the course you will be expected to attend each class and section.

subject: ECON
